instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2289: What is A2289? A2289 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2020 with EMC 3456, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01987..
definitions.820-01987: What is 820-01987? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" 2020 - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>)
threads.message: Hello, this is my new training, a friend has brought me this equipment with a plate damaged by liquid (attached photos) I ask for help because to begin with it is my first time with this model

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" 2020 - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>)
threads.message:
First check diode mode to ground on all power rails; including <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> LDOs.
If nothing strange, apply power and check what voltages appear.

Wotk with the board alone on the desk.
